app.users.controllers module¶

app.users.controllers.create_or_update_user(username, password, user_id=None)[source]¶

Creates or updates an user.

Username:a string object
Password:a string object (plaintext)
User_id:a str object. Indicates an update.
Returns:a dict with the operation result

Delete an user by user id.

User_id:a str object
Returns:a dict with the operation result

Username:a string object
Returns:a dict with the operation result
app.users.controllers.is_an_available_username(username)[source]¶

Returns:True or False

app.users.models module¶

class app.users.models.User(*args, **values)[source]¶

Bases: flask_mongoengine.Document

User model

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: mongoengine.errors.DoesNotExist

exception User.MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: mongoengine.errors.MultipleObjectsReturned

User.id¶

A field wrapper around MongoDB’s ObjectIds.

User.objects¶

The default QuerySet Manager.

Custom QuerySet Manager functions can extend this class and users can add extra queryset functionality. Any custom manager methods must accept a Document class as its first argument, and a QuerySet as its second argument.

The method function should return a QuerySet , probably the same one that was passed in, but modified in some way.

User.password¶

A unicode string field.

User.to_json2()[source]¶

Returns a json representantion of the user. :returns: a json object.

User.username¶

A unicode string field.
